alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 28 at 2:16AM CDT until October 30 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR GUADALUPE PASS... * WHAT...For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 possible. For the High Wind Watch, northeast winds 55 to 65 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible. * WHERE...For the Freeze Watch, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains in Texas. For the High Wind Watch, Guadalupe Pass. * WHEN...For the Freeze Watch, from Sunday evening through Monday afternoon. For the High Wind Watch, from Sunday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
